posts.post_content: Colourful, curly dingle-shoes are awesome. But... they are not sandals. Seriously.

Posted By: Kirbster (12/20/2010 12:42:02 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Even back then I was annoyed at all the attempts by Wizards to get 'Islandwalk' on the battlefield in some way. I don't understand why 'Islandwalk' was pushed so hard. This card, [Fishliver Oil](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fishliver Oil), [Part Water](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Part Water), [War Barge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=War Barge) etc... Not that there's anything wrong with Islandwalk, but it certainly seemed to be a point of interest for someone in R&D, almost a fetish I'd say.
posts.html:
Even back then I was annoyed at all the attempts by Wizards to get 'Islandwalk' on the battlefield in some way. I don't understand why 'Islandwalk' was pushed so hard. This card, Fishliver Oil, Part Water, War Barge etc... Not that there's anything wrong with Islandwalk, but it certainly seemed to be a point of interest for someone in R&D, almost a fetish I'd say.

Rating:

posts.post_content:
Blue mages have always been powerfull, so there should be ways to foil them. Islandwalking is just one of those and very neat one: it's not automatic win, but it's quite a threat.  
  
@holgir: Mono Artifact has always meant and will always mean: tap when used.
posts.html:

Posted By: tavaritz (4/27/2011 12:54:54 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
that card is soo 0,5/5.  
  
![4](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=4&type=symbol) and ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![Tap](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=tap&type=symbol) each turn for making a creature an islandwalker?   
that's not even useful with [Merfolk Assassin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Merfolk Assassin) since you have to sacrifice the sandals then.  
btw, did you notice that [Flying Carpet](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Flying Carpet) also had that disadvantage until 6th Edition Oracle?  
i wonder whether wizards would change the Oracle of a card like this again if those sandals became reprinted.  
  
anyways - the name, artwork and "realistic effect" are funny, though.
posts.html:
that card is soo 0,5/5.

and each turn for making a creature an islandwalker?
that's not even useful with Merfolk Assassin since you have to sacrifice the sandals then.
btw, did you notice that Flying Carpet also had that disadvantage until 6th Edition Oracle?
i wonder whether wizards would change the Oracle of a card like this again if those sandals became reprinted.

anyways - the name, artwork and "realistic effect" are funny, though.

Posted By: midnightvenom (5/6/2010 12:26:50 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
And because the sandals were such a great success, they made [War Barge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=War Barge) for The Dark as a counterpart that destroys the islandwalking creature when the artifact leaves play.
  
And as with [Staff of Zegon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Staff of Zegon) they made the card a lot worse than it already was by inserting a ![Tap](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=tap&type=symbol) into the activation cost, probably "because it was originally intended that way" ... oh dear, these rigidnesses!
posts.html:
And because the sandals were such a great success, they made War Barge for The Dark as a counterpart that destroys the islandwalking creature when the artifact leaves play.
And as with Staff of Zegon they made the card a lot worse than it already was by inserting a into the activation cost, probably "because it was originally intended that way" ... oh dear, these rigidnesses!
